intro: Stylidium lobuliflorum, commonly known as the horned triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred petals that resemble horns. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in dry, sunny environments. Its unique morphology and striking appearance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
